definition: Yuan Shikai (1859-1916), senior general of late Qing, subsequently warlord and self-proclaimed emperor of China
surname Yuan
long robe (old)
surname Shi
life/age/generation/era/world/lifetime/epoch/descendant/noble
triumphant/victorious/chi (Greek letter Χχ)
surname Kai

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai quickly seized the fruits of the victory of the 1911 Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凯迅速篡夺了辛亥革命的胜利果实。

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai forced emperor to abdicate and hand over power to him.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凯逼迫皇帝逊位，把政权交给了他。

sentences.english: Yuan Shih-Kai once promised to uphold Republican principles.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凯曾经信誓旦旦，说要坚持共和原则。

sentences.english: ‘Go and tell Yuan Shikai nicely that he must save us.’
sentences.chinese: 去告诉袁世凯，请他来救我们吧。

sentences.english: The second part is an analysis of the members of the council of Yuan Shikai.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分则对袁世凯幕府成员进行了分析归类。

sentences.english: Shikai quickly seized the fruits of the victory of the1911 Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凯迅速篡夺了辛亥革命的胜利果实。

sentences.english: The author also evaluates Yu an Shikai and his policies under the Late Qing Reform.
sentences.chinese: 作者还对袁世凯与北洋新政作了评价。

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai quickly seized the fruits of the victory of the1911 Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凯迅速篡夺了辛亥革命的胜利果实。

sentences.english: The council of Yuan Shikai is the representative of this new system.
sentences.chinese: 这一种新型的幕府，袁世凯幕府便是其中代表之一。

sentences.english: It is external manifestation of army construction that he paid attention to weaponry .
sentences.chinese: 重视武器装备，是袁世凯军队建设的外在表现形式。

definition: Duan Qirui (1864-1936), commander of Beiyang Army under Yuan Shikai, then politician and powerful warlord
Xu Shichang (1855-1939), politician associated with the Northern Warlords, president of China in 1921
Cao Kun (1862-1938), one of the Northern Warlords
Zhang Zuolin (c. 1873-1928), warlord of Manchuria 1916-1928
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
the Warlord government of Northern China that developed from the Qing Beiyang army 北洋軍閥|北洋军阀 after the Xinhai revolution of 1911
president (of a country)/same as 總統|总统
Li Hung-chang or Li Hongzhang (1823-1901), Qing dynasty general, politician and diplomat
reign name of penultimate Qing emperor Guangxu or Guang-hsu (1875-1908)
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
Ni Sichong (1868-1924), general closely linked to Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 during his unsuccessful 1915 bid for Empire
the Northern Warlords (1912-1927)
north China army, a modernizing Western-style army set up during late Qing, and a breeding ground for the Northern Warlords after the Qinghai revolution
Empress Dowager Cixi or Ts'u Hsi (reigned 1861-1908)
Empress Dowager Cixi or Ts'u Hsi (1835-1908), regent 1861-1908
Manchu Restoration of 1917, an attempt by general 張勳|张勋[Zhanɡ1 Xun1] to reinstate the monarchy in China by restoring the abdicated emperor Puyi 溥儀|溥仪[Pu3 yi2] to the throne
